section.name: Bloomreach Experience Manager Reset Password
section.p: This project provides basic reset password functionality.

section.name: Code base on GitHub
section.p: The code of this project is on GitHub at https://github.com/onehippo-forge/reset-password/.

subsection.name: Add the Forge repository configuration
subsection.p: In the main pom.xml of the project, in the repositories section, add this repository if it is not configured there yet.

subsection.name: Method 1: use Essentials plugin
subsection.p: In the Essentials pom.xml of the project, add following dependency.
subsection.div: Now build and run the project; from Essentials choose the Reset Password feature.

subsection.name: Method 2: manual installation
subsection.h4: Add version property to the project pom
subsection.p: In the main pom.xml of the project, in the properties section, add this property. For the correct version number, check the Release Notes page.
Add the following dependencies to the cms/pom.xml:
subsection.div:
<dependency> <groupId>org.bloomreach.forge.resetpassword</groupId> <artifactId>resetpassword-bootstrap-configuration</artifactId> <version>${forge.resetpassword.version}</version> </dependency>
Registers e-mail module, extended login page and the resetpassword functionality.

<dependency> <groupId>org.bloomreach.forge.resetpassword</groupId> <artifactId>resetpassword-bootstrap-content</artifactId> <version>${forge.resetpassword.version}</version> </dependency>
Adds a content document to the repository at /content/documents/resetpassword/password-reset containing all labels and duration configuration.
Note: before version 3.0, the artifacts' groupId was org.onehippo.forge

section.name: After installation
section.subsection: The plugin contains a bootstrapping modules with group "bloomreach-forge". Make sure your project bootstraps later than that, by setting after: [hippo-cms, bloomreach-forge] in the hcm-module.yaml file of the repository-data application module.
